suncertify.services
Class ContractorManager

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.services.ContractorManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
BusinessServices
public class ContractorManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements BusinessServices

Actually implements the BusinessServices interface designed to support lean clients. Fulfills client requests in close proximity to the data access point. In the model-view-controller (MVC) setting, the ContractorManager represents the role of the server-side model.

Each client request (search, book) is mapped to exactly one distinguished method call of the ContractorManager object. In this method, the request is translated into a sequence of database operations to be executed in rapid succession in the context of a single thread. The contractor manager acts as the liaison between the client and the data access class and abstracts from the data access operations.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Lars Kuettner

Constructor Detail

ContractorManager

public ContractorManager(java.lang.String databaseLocation)
                  throws ServicesException
Creates an instance of the contractor manager that provides an implementation for the BusinessServices interface.

The contractor manager functions as the model component in the MVC setting.

Parameters:
databaseLocation - a string representing the path name to the database file
Throws:
ServicesException - if the Singleton instance of the data access class could not be obtained
Method Detail

terminate

public final void terminate()
Terminates the contractor manager. Relays the termination request to the data access class. Called upon exit.

search

public final java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,Contractor> search(java.lang.String name,
                                                             java.lang.String location)
                                                      throws ServicesException
Description copied from interface: BusinessServices
Searches the database for all contractor records with a given name and/or location, and returns a collection of the matching records together with their record numbers for further reference. The search items must match exactly, or be null meaning anything matches.

Specified by:
search in interface BusinessServices
Parameters:
name - A string representing the contractor name to search for. If not null, an exact match is required. If null, embraces all records.
location - A string representing the location to search for. If not null, an exact match is required. If null, embraces all records.
Returns:
a map of all matching (record number, contractor) pairs
Throws:
ServicesException - if an unexpected problem with the data access class is encountered

book

public final BookResult book(long recNo,
                             Contractor contractor)
                      throws ServicesException
Description copied from interface: BusinessServices
Attempts to book a record given by its record number. Successfully booking the record in this context means updating the record with the contractor provided. A record should only be updated if it:
  1. is still a valid record, that is, if it has not been deleted,
  2. has not been intermittently updated or replaced, and
  3. has not been booked by some other agent

Specified by:
book in interface BusinessServices
Parameters:
recNo - the record number of the record to book acting as the primary key into the database
contractor - the Contractor object with which to update the record pending the above-mentioned constraints
Returns:
A BookResult object representing the result of the booking operation. Consists of the BookStatus and the Contractor object post-booking.
Throws:
ServicesException - if an unexpected problem with the data access class is encountered. A record having been intermittently deleted does not trigger this exception as this should be reckoned with.
